author: Willy
content:
A luxury yacht passes through the narrow channel of the cut. Apparently there are bridges that would need extending to make it wider.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-lOz4sR827M

author: Willy
content: To the suggestions. All of them terriffic. Yet its a matter of politics and money. The politics means shutting down what normally gets a bandaid. The money would be shutting it down for years to facilitate dredging.

author: Peter Wright
content:
Perhaps take advantage and widen, deepen and stabilise it?

Sorry for being simplistic, I am just an engineer.

author: Jean-Pierre Declemy
content: As the canal has been open for over a century and has suffered many previous rock falls you would think they would have practice at clearing blockages quickly, have the equipment on standby and even carry out inspections so that preventative repairs could be made. They could probably get funds from the EU.
